p: 1. Beginning with our practical dealings with things. To show the being of what we first encounter in our engagement with meaning, we will study our practical dealings with things in our lived worlds of meaning. These dealings include many forms of involvement and concern, the most immediate of which is not detached perceiving of “objects out there” but rather using things, handling them, doing something with them. Such practical concerns have their own particular kind of knowing. We now ask how about the being of these objects of practical concern: How are they meaningfully present to us? — But first a remark about method.
